```{r}
library(RNRCS)
library(lubridate)
library(dplyr)
library(weathermetrics)
```

```{r}
#download Joe Wright SNOTEL data from WY 2010 to present and add as a df. Also, get date into correct format.
JWhourly_SNO <- grabNRCS.data(network = "SNTL", site_id = 551, timescale = "hourly", DayBgn = '2009-10-01', DayEnd = '2020-08-27') %>%
  mutate(Date = ymd_hm(Date))

#get into correct units and make sure the new columns are numeric (except date)
JWhourly_SNO$AirTemp_C <- fahrenheit.to.celsius(JWhourly_SNO$Air.Temperature.Observed..degF.)
JWhourly_SNO$SWE_mm <- JWhourly_SNO$Snow.Water.Equivalent..in.*25.4
JWhourly_SNO$SnowDepth_mm<-JWhourly_SNO$Snow.Depth..in.*25.4
JWhourly_SNO$CumPrecip_mm<-JWhourly_SNO$Precipitation.Accumulation..in. *25.4
JWhourly_SNO[2:9] <- lapply(JWhourly_SNO[2:9], as.numeric)

#create new df that has all the proper units from above
JW_hourly <- JWhourly_SNO[c(1,6:9)]

#NOTE TO SELF: UPDATE THIS SECTION AND SNOW D, SWE. ALSO, UPDATE COLUMNS NAMES ABOVE TO INDICATE IT IS CUMULATIVE. Since Precip is cumulative - we need to find the total daily values
JW_SNOTEL$DPrecip_mm <- ave(JW_SNOTEL$CumPrecip_mm, FUN=function(x) c(0, diff(x)))



#export the df to csv
write.csv(JW_SNOTEL,"C:/Users/sears/Documents/Research/Snow_Hydro_Research/Fire/JW_SNOTEL_daily.csv", row.names = TRUE)

#determine NAs in SWE_mm
sum(is.na(JW_SNOTEL$SWE_mm))
```
